00064 enum VALUE_OPERATOR {
00065     
00066     VALUE_MOD_OPERATOR,         // %
00067     VALUE_ADD_OPERATOR,         // +
00068     VALUE_SUB_OPERATOR,         // -
00069     VALUE_MUL_OPERATOR,         // *
00070     VALUE_DIV_OPERATOR,         // /
00071     VALUE_NEG_OPERATOR,         // -
00072     VALUE_POS_OPERATOR,         // +
00073     VALUE_AND_OPERATOR,         // &&
00074     VALUE_OR_OPERATOR,          // ||
00075     VALUE_EQL_OPERATOR,         // ==
00076     VALUE_NEQ_OPERATOR,         // !=
00077     VALUE_GRE_OPERATOR,         // >
00078     VALUE_LES_OPERATOR,         // <
00079     VALUE_GEQ_OPERATOR,         // >=
00080     VALUE_LEQ_OPERATOR,         // <=
00081     VALUE_NOT_OPERATOR,         // !
00082     VALUE_NO_OPERATOR           // no operation at all
00083 };
00084 
00085 enum VALUE_DATA_TYPE {
00086     VALUE_NO_TYPE,              // abstract baseclass
00087     VALUE_INT_TYPE,
00088     VALUE_FLOAT_TYPE,
00089     VALUE_STRING_TYPE,
00090     VALUE_BOOL_TYPE,
00091     VALUE_ERROR_TYPE,
00092     VALUE_EMPTY_TYPE,
00093     VALUE_SOLID_TYPE,
00094     VALUE_COMBISOLID_TYPE,
00095     VALUE_VECTOR_TYPE,
00096     VALUE_MENU_TYPE,
00097     VALUE_ACTOR_TYPE,
00098     VALUE_MAX_TYPE              //only here to provide number of types
00099 };

00107 struct HashableInt 
00108 {
00109     HashableInt(int id)                                                         : mData(id) { }
00110 
00111     unsigned long               Hash() const                                            { return 0;} 
00112     
00113     bool                operator==(HashableInt rhs)                             { return mData == rhs.mData; }
00114     
00115     int                 mData;
00116 };

00119 //
00120 // Bitfield that stores the flags for each CValue derived class
00121 //
00122 struct ValueFlags {
00123     ValueFlags() :
00124         Modified(true),
00125         Selected(false),
00126         Affected(false),
00127         ReleaseRequested(false),
00128         Error(false),
00129         RefCountDisabled(false),
00130         HasProperties(false),
00131         HasName(false),
00132         Visible(true),
00133         CustomFlag1(false),
00134         CustomFlag2(false)
00135     {
00136     }
00137 
00138     unsigned short Modified : 1;
00139     unsigned short Selected : 1;
00140     unsigned short Affected : 1;
00141     unsigned short ReleaseRequested : 1;
00142     unsigned short Error : 1;
00143     unsigned short RefCountDisabled : 1;
00144     unsigned short HasProperties : 1;
00145     unsigned short HasName : 1;
00146     unsigned short Visible : 1;
00147     unsigned short CustomFlag1 : 1;
00148     unsigned short CustomFlag2 : 1;
00149 
00150     
00151 };

00253 
00255     int                 GetRefCount()                                           
00256     { 
00257         return m_refcount; 
00258     }
00259 
00260     // Add a reference to this value
00261     CValue*             AddRef()                                                
00262     {
00263         // Increase global reference count, used to see at the end of the program
00264         // if all CValue-derived classes have been dereferenced to 0
00265         //debug(gRefCountValue++);
00266     #ifdef _DEBUG
00267         //gRefCountValue++;
00268     #endif
00269         m_refcount++; 
00270         return this;
00271     }
00272 
00273     // Release a reference to this value (when reference count reaches 0, the value is removed from the heap)
00274     int         Release()                               
00275     {
00276         // Decrease global reference count, used to see at the end of the program
00277         // if all CValue-derived classes have been dereferenced to 0
00278         //debug(gRefCountValue--);
00279     #ifdef _DEBUG
00280         //gRefCountValue--;
00281     #endif
00282         // Decrease local reference count, if it reaches 0 the object should be freed
00283         if (--m_refcount > 0)
00284         {
00285             // Reference count normal, return new reference count
00286             return m_refcount;
00287         }
00288         else
00289         {
00290             // Reference count reached 0, delete ourselves and return 0
00291     //      MT_assert(m_refcount==0, "Reference count reached sub-zero, object released too much");
00292             
00293             delete this;
00294             return 0;
00295         }
00296     }
00297

00342     virtual void        SetAffected(bool bAffected=true)                        { m_ValFlags.Affected = bAffected; }

00344     inline void         SetError(bool err)                                      { m_ValFlags.Error=err; }
00345     inline void         SetVisible (bool vis)                                   { m_ValFlags.Visible=vis; }
00346                                                                                 
00347     virtual bool        IsModified()                                            { return m_ValFlags.Modified; }
00348     inline bool         IsError()                                               { return m_ValFlags.Error; }
00349     virtual bool        IsAffected()                                            { return m_ValFlags.Affected || m_ValFlags.Modified; }
00350     virtual bool        IsSelected()                                            { return m_ValFlags.Selected; }
00351     inline bool         IsReleaseRequested()                                    { return m_ValFlags.ReleaseRequested; }
00352     virtual bool        IsVisible()                                             { return m_ValFlags.Visible;}
00353     virtual void        SetCustomFlag1(bool bCustomFlag)                        { m_ValFlags.CustomFlag1 = bCustomFlag;}
00354     virtual bool        IsCustomFlag1()                                         { return m_ValFlags.CustomFlag1;}
00355

00357     virtual bool        IsCustomFlag2()                                         { return m_ValFlags.CustomFlag2;}

00374 //
00375 // Declare a CValue or CExpression or CWhatever to be serialized by the editor.
00376 //
00377 // This macro introduces the EdSerialize() function (which must be implemented by
00378 // the client) and the EdIdSerialize() function (which is implemented by this macro).
00379 //
00380 // The generated Copy() function returns a pointer to <root_base_class_name> type
00381 // of object. So, for *any* CValue-derived object this should be set to CValue,
00382 // for *any* CExpression-derived object this should be set to CExpression.
00383 //
00384 #define PLUGIN_DECLARE_SERIAL(class_name, root_base_class_name)                \
00385 public:                                                                        \
00386     virtual root_base_class_name *Copy() {                                     \
00387         return new class_name;                                                 \
00388     }                                                                          \
00389     virtual bool EdSerialize(CompressorArchive& arch,                          \
00390                              class CFactoryManager* facmgr,                    \
00391                              bool bIsStoring);                                 \
00392     virtual bool EdIdSerialize(CompressorArchive& arch,                        \
00393                                class CFactoryManager* facmgr,                  \
00394                                bool bIsStoring)                                \
00395     {                                                                          \
00396         if (bIsStoring)                                                        \
00397             arch.StoreString(#class_name);                                     \
00398         return false;                                                          \
00399     }                                                                          \
00400 
00401 
00405 
00406 // CPropValue is a CValue derived class, that implements the identification (String name)
00407 // SetName() / GetName(), 
00408 // normal classes should derive from CPropValue, real lightweight classes straight from CValue
00409 
00410 
00411 class CPropValue : public CValue
00412 {
00413 public:
00414     CPropValue() :
00415       CValue(),
00416         m_strNewName()
00417 
00418     {
00419     }
00420     
00421     virtual ~CPropValue()
00422     {
00423     }
00424     
00425     virtual void            SetName(const char *name) {
00426         m_strNewName = name;
00427     }
00428     
00429     virtual STR_String&         GetName() {
00430         //STR_String namefromprop = GetPropertyText("Name");
00431         //if (namefromprop.Length() > 0)
00432         //  return namefromprop;
00433         return m_strNewName;
00434     }                       // name of Value
00435     
00436 protected:
00437     STR_String                  m_strNewName;                   // Identification
00438 
00439 
00440 #ifdef WITH_CXX_GUARDEDALLOC
00441 public:
00442     void *operator new(size_t num_bytes) { return MEM_mallocN(num_bytes, "GE:CPropValue"); }
00443     void operator delete( void *mem ) { MEM_freeN(mem); }
00444 #endif
00445 };
